passage_text: Organs in the human body: Functions, location, definition of organs. An organ is a structure that contains at least two different types of tissue functioning together for a common purpose. There are many different organs in the body: the liver, kidneys, heart, even your skin is an organ. Usually there is a main tissue and sporadic tissues.

The major organ in the body of human beings is the brain which is primarily responsible for performing all the functions and actions of the body. Other major organs of the body are given in the following list with names, diseases, location and functions. 1  Adrenal Glands. 2  Anus.

Split and merge into it. Answer by Annabel Davies. Confidence votes 43. all the organs in the human body are included in all the systems of the human body for example. the circulatory system has the the heart which is an organ the respiratory system has the lungs which is an organ.

Organs in the Human BodyAn organ is a structure that contains at least two different types of tissue functioning together for a common purpose. Some organs in the human body include (alphabetical order): The Main Ones; 1  adrenal glands. 2  anus. 3  appendix. 4  bladder. 5  bones. 6  brain. 7  bronchi.

all the organs in the human body are included in all the systems of the human body for example. the circulatory system has the the heart which is an organ the respiratory … system has the lungs which is an organ. so in order to fine the organs in the body it's a good approach to first find the systems.
